sentences.en: ...an eerily prescient comedy about a populist multimillionaire political candidate.
sentences.cn: ...围绕一位身价数百万的民粹主义政治候选人的一部喜剧，其预见性近乎诡异。

sentences.en: In this , the critics were unfortunately quite prescient.
sentences.cn: 非常不幸, 这些批评有着很高的预见性.

sentences.en: It was a remarkably prescient vision.
Regrettably for Australia, that report appears remarkably prescient.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是, 该报告的预测惊人地准确.

sentences.en: Though absurdly unscientific even for its time, phrenology was remarkably prescient - up to a point.
sentences.cn: 尽管颅相学在当时显得不符合科学原理,是荒谬的,在某种程度上, 颅相学仍是非常有先见性的.

trans.tran_cn: 有预知能力的，有先见之明的
trans.tran_en: able to imagine or know what will happen in the future
